page.title: 12New Forest-Felling Deciduous
page.content:
The yield of{Deciduous or hardwood trees from the whole New Forest is approximately 5000 tons per annum. The New Forest hardwood is of low quality due to the poor soil of the area. Therefore in spite of the longer growing time than softwoods or conifers, it fetches only about Â£36/cubic metre (compared to Â£47 for Douglas Fir, and Â£37 for Corsican Pine) however hardwoods are planted to provide variety and a pleasing environment for an area which is also used for leisure by many people. Hardwood is used in these ways: 1. 10% is of furniture quality and is cut into short planking. 2. 40-50% is used for fencing material. 3. 40-50% goes to mines.
{Cont>
